page.title: 17Interviewing Mr/Mrs.Fielder
page.content: We went to Mr.& Mrs. Fielder's house on 14th July 1985 to interview them. They have lived in Lavant over 82 years. They had to leave school at the age of 14. The job that Mr.Fielder had to do first was for Mr.& Mrs. Denman in their house. Then he worked in a factory then did gardening. Mrs. Fielder worked for the Lowes as a Nanny. We asked them if they had noticed any changes in Lavant. They said lots of cottages have gone and there is not so much farmland. Before cars, horses & carts took people up to Goodwood. Roads changed from stones to tarmac. They said life is better now than it was years ago. Mr.Fielder went to Lavant School and his Headmaster was Mr.Young, but his wife didn't. He said they were very strict. They often got the cane for talking.
